item.title: How We Analyzed the Justice Department’s Death in Custody Data
item.description: A rare look into data collected under the Death in Custody Reporting Act revealed serious problems.

item.title: Why Doesn’t the U.S. Government Know How Many People Die in Custody?
item.description: Under the Death in Custody Reporting Act, the government is supposed to track how many people die in law enforcement custody — but the data is a mess.

item.title: Who Answers for a Death in Custody?
item.description: A Houston mother is one of many nationwide left with grief and unanswered questions when a loved one dies behind bars.

item.title: After a Death Behind Bars, Families Struggle for Answers. This Guide Can Help.
item.description: Learn what questions to ask prison or jail officials, how to request key records and what to consider if you’re thinking about legal action.

item.title: Unsolved, Not Forgotten: How Six Parents Remember the Children They Lost to Violence
item.description: These families have yet to see justice in the deaths of their loved ones. Amid the grief, they are fighting to keep their memories from fading.
